desc: Finishes an upload started with files.getUploadURLExternal

token.desc: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

files.desc: Array of file ids and their corresponding (optional) titles.

channel_id.desc: Channel ID where the file will be shared. If not specified the file will be private.

thread_ts.desc: Provide another message's `ts` value to upload this file as a reply. Never use a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead. Also make sure to provide only one channel when using 'thread_ts'

channels.desc: Comma-separated string of channel IDs where the file will be shared.

initial_comment.desc: The message text introducing the file in specified channels.

blocks.desc: A JSON-based array of structured rich text blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string. If the `initial_comment` field is provided, the `blocks` field is ignored

access_denied.desc: User is not the owner of the file.

file_not_found.desc: Could not find the file from the upload ticket.

file_update_failed.desc: Failure occurred when attempting to update the file.

invalid_blocks.desc: Provided blocks are in the incorrect format.

invalid_channel.desc: Channel could not be found or channel specified is invalid.

not_in_channel.desc: User/bot membership is required for the specified channel.

posting_to_channel_denied.desc: User is not authorized to post to channel.

channels_limit_exceeded.desc: Exceeded the channel limit. A maximum of 100 channels is allowed per request.

error.description: Typical error response for an invalid token
